result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don L Tyler

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

COURT CALLS 22CM35 AND 22CM36. 
8:47 AM Defendant Don L Tyler in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant Don Tyler and Defendant Jacqueline Tyler state that they are unrepresented by counsel at this time after being denied by the PD's office and being denied a court appointed attorney. 
Both Defendants state they would like to take the pre-trial offer from the State for resolution, but would still like to discuss some detail with the State. 
Court will set both cases over for projected plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Don L Tyler in court.   

State is now not willing to amend this charge and will require a plea to the charge.
Defendant presented statements to the court.
Court advises of right to an attorney.
Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Don L Tyler in court.  

State would be looking at a possible amendment with payment of up front restitution - However, restitution request just went out.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Denied.

records.addlTxt:
02:57 PM Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Don L Tyler in court.  
Case called for status of counsel. 
Defendant advises the court that she has not retained counsel.  
**Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Defendant sworn. 
Court finds that defendant is not eligible for court appointed attorney. **
Court will set this matter for one more status hearing date.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Don L Tyler in court.  

Defendant has not retained and doesn't want to retain counsel and proceed Pro-Se.
Court advises of right to an attorney.
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his ability to proceed pro-se.
Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed pro-se and represent himself.


  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:04 AM Defendant Don L Tyler in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
